org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.writer.deprecated
Class JDBCWriteConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.core.connector.AbstractWriteConnector
          org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.writer.deprecated.JDBCWriteConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, ITransactional, IWriteConnector
Deprecated. Use NewJDBCWriteConnector instead

public class JDBCWriteConnector
extends AbstractWriteConnector
implements ITransactional

Processes data by executing PreparedStatements against a database.

The conversion of the data to a prepared statement is delegate to an IStatementConverter, the default is a StatementConverter which calls toString() on data (i.e. it assumes that an upstream component has converted the data to valid SQL).

Author:
J Perry, Russ Fennell, higginse
See Also:
IStatementConverter, JDBCConnection

getResource

public java.lang.Object getResource()
Deprecated. 
Description copied from interface: ITransactional
If the implementation wants to take part in the current transaction then it should either return an instance of ITransactionalResource or and instance of XAResource. It is assumed that the configured transaction manager that creates the actual transaction will match type of resource return. Return null if the component is not configured to be transactional.

Specified by:
getResource in interface ITransactional
Returns:
the transaction resource if the connection is transacted or null otherwise
